content.description:
Generally climbers Head up Râteau de chèvre before finishing off on Batman under the roof. 
  
 Une majorité de grimpeur on tendance a monter râteau de chèvre avant de terminer dans Batman sous le toit.

Lower and left of the Ampitheater slabby start.
.

Look for the crux in the third pitch. Trust your feet and commit!

Same first two pitches as Batman, instead of going right on the third, go straight up and into the corner. 
Full rack with a set of nuts

climbs.name: Faucon rouge directe
climbs.fa: Paul Laperrière et Jean Laperrière, 1974. Première ascension libre Normand Cadieux

content.description:
P1 :
Reach the first belay of Amphitheater by the route of your choice. Gear anchor.
P2 :
Directly to the left of the first belay, make a large crossing on a large ramp of about 10-15 meters. The second anchor is on the small platform at the end of the ramp. Gear anchor, a little difficult to build.
P3 :
Go up in a straight to an old bird's nest. From there, "embark" in the crack above the small overhang. A lot of atmosphere! Tree anchor.

L1 :
Atteindre le premier relais de la voie de l’Amphithéâtre par le passage de votre choix. Relais sur pro.
L2 :
Directement à gauche du premier relais, faire une grande traversée sur une grande rampe d'environ 10-15 mètres. Le deuxième relais est sur la petite plateforme au bout de la rampe. Relais sur protection un peu difficile.
L3 :
Monter en ligne droite jusqu'à un ancien nid d'oiseau. De là, "embarquez" dans la craque au-dessus du petit surplomb. Beaucoup d'ambiance ! Relais sur arbre.


Trad route. Up to #3 

Escalade traditionnel. Cam jusqu’à #3

A bouldery crack test-piece. From the higher ledge, reach up on slopes to gain a left trending crack. Follow the crack to a good hold then go up. The gear seems to be hard to put in.

This thing start atop a ledge. Access the ledge where the climbs "Verrat de Vérot (5.12b)" and Rikiki (A2+) starts. Climb the bolts on the left wall to get to an higher ledge. This is the start of a climb called "Ambiance (5.11b)".
Finger sized and micro cams

1. Cross slab (little to no pro) and mantle up ledge on the left end. follow ledge to the right and climb up the thin cracks to a mantle on the next ledge. 2. Climb up to a small roof/corner with a crack in the back, sloping ledge to the right, get up on ledge (crux) and traverse right to sloping ledge with a big crack. 3. traverse right to corner (exposed) and (V1) keep traversing right to last vertical crack and head up over to a ledge (possible to belay here to see your second) and to the top of the cliff. V1 - Head diagonally up the crack. 1. Traversez la grosse dalle (pas grand protection) et surmontez le petit mur pour atterrir sur une vire, suivez la vire jusqu’à un relais sur pro. 2. Montez le petit surplomb/coin avec une grosse craque dans le fond, rétablissez sur la tablette en pente et traversez a la prochaine tablette pour y faire un relais. 3. Traversez a droite jusqu'au coin (expose) et (V1) continuez de traverser la face jusqu’à la deuxième fissure que vous suivez a la vire (relais possible pour voir le second) jusqu'au sommet. V1 - Suivez la craque diagonale Right end of the amphitheatre, start off on the ledge just left/under Ben's Roof.
Rap down double ropes the overhanging amphitheatre (amazing) or do 2 rappels off the right ledge (hanging rap bolts). Protect your second!!!!
big pieces are nice to have on the second and third pitches.

P1:
Reach the first belay on top of the ledge. Gear anchor.

P2/P3:
Start to the right, then come back to the left, passing under the roof. Last anchor on tree (?).
More info on the second anchor would be appreciated!


L1 :
Atteindre le premier relais sur la vire. Relais sur pro.

L2/L3 :
Débuter vers la droite, puis revenir vers la gauche en passant sous le toit. Dernier relais sur arbre (?). Plus d’info sur le second relais serait appréciée!



First route on the left of the crag.

Première voie à gauche de la paroi.


Trad route

Topping a small roof in the middle of the route to embark on a slab! Really fun sequence. Run the crack on the face below Toit de Ben roof and then follow the corner to exit via Variation de l'éclair 5.9 (first distinct horizontal crack) or l'Amphitéatre 5.8 (second horizontal and vertical cracks). Passer le petit toit au millieu de la voie pour se rétablir sur la dalle, une séquence très amusante. Passez la fissure sur la face inférieure du toit du Toit de Ben, puis suivez le coin pour sortir par Variation de l'éclair 5.9 (première fissure horizontale distincte) ou l'Amphitéatre 5.8 (deuxième fissure horizontale et verticale). Just left of Toit de Ben, the crack on the face, easier (5.9+) if you start via le Toit de Ben around the corner on the left. Same start as Amphithéatre.

Juste a gauche du toit de Ben, la fissure sur la face, départ plus facile (5.9+) en prennant le départ du toit de Ben juste a gauche dans le coin. Meme départ que Amphithéatre. Full rack, bolted anchor at the exit, 70m rope will get you down.

Rack complet, relais équipé à la sortie, une corde de 70m pour le rappel.

climbs.name: La Bataille des Corbeaux (AKA: Le Tunnel du Toit)
climbs.fa: FA: Raymond Jotterand & Joe Francioni; FFA: Jerome St-Michel - June 5, 2019

content.description:
This is an old aid line which was freed in 2019. It was rated 5.6/A1 and originally called "Le tunnel du toit". I decided to rename the route as I think everything has progressed since the first ascensionist came and did it. By progress, I mean the climbing gear, the general experience level of the community, the physical skills have all evolved so much, its like we are just doing a different sport!  

I can't be sure for now if this is really a FFA, because it is just not as hard as the test-piece routes putted up by the locals. Anyway, it is a super classic traverse under a huge roof where you have to make use of a pretty thin crack. Plenty of air underneath your feets!

Start by climbing the first pitch of Le Toit de Ben (5.9). Climb on the gendarme, which as the bolted anchor on it, and use big holds to reach the horizontal. There is a bolt that belongs to the sport project, the one that climbs the roof, don't clip it, it's not necessary! Start the long and pumpy rightward traverse, trying to get the most out of the crack. The climbing eases as you get further right to reach a thanks god stemming stance. Use a chockstone and make your way up a short section of chimney. A classic, go get it!

There are a few pins (3) to clip, but they all look kinda manky.

This is the horizontal crack that links Le Toit de Ben into Perseverance.
A few micro cams, a 0.75 and a 2.

The obvious line of bolts on the left side of the terrace to the left of Faucon rouge. Climb the ridge on small crimp before trying to sit on his left heel to clip on the last bolt. Long move to get the crack on the right (crux) and then a mega jug awaits you. Equipped by Pierre, Jean do and Ben.

La ligne de plaquettes évidente à gauche de la terrasse à gauche de Faucon rouge. Grimper l’arête sur de petit crimp avant d’essayer de s’asseoir sur son talon gauche pour clipser a dernière plaquette. Long move pour aller chercher la fissure à droite (crux) et ensuite un mega jug vous attend. Équipé par Pierre, Jean do et Ben. 



To the left of the amphitheater slab there is a huge ledge (about 20m). You have to go on this ledge to reach the route. Either traverse the slab or rappel from the top.

A gauche de la dalle de l’Amphithéâtre il y a une énorme vire (environ 20m). Il faut se rendre sur cette vire pour atteindre  la voie. Sois grimper la dalle ou descendre en rappel du haut.


Bolted (stick clip for first bolt).

Plaquette (stick clip pour première bolt).

climbs.name: Le Toit de Ben
climbs.fa: FA: Bernard Poisson (September 21st, 1958) FFA: François Roy (August 30, 1987)

content.description:
The obvious crack splitting a 10m long horizontal roof just right of the Amphitheatre. 

This world class route has it all: feet first climbing, a bat hang, an enduro section on good hand jams, and a powerful lip. It also protects well. 

It was first aided in 1958 by Bernard Poisson using home made wooden pieces as protection. 30 years went by without anyone managing to free the route until the sequence was unlocked in 1987 by François Roy. It then stood as the park's hardest line for another decade. 

Many climbers spend weeks rehearsing the pro and the moves, this route is a serious undertaking.



On the right of the Ampitheater slab, climb up the corner leading into L'Éclair, then traverse right to the belay of Ben's Roof


Bolted belays.

Standard rack up to #3, double in small sizes

It is useful to (pre)place a big nut (wild country 11 or equivalent) inverted (wire up) at the end of the roof to prevent the rope from getting inside the crack

climbs.name: Perseverance
climbs.fa: 1977, Normand Cadieux et Edourd Pierre Gagnon

content.description:
Starts directly under the roof in a awkward fingery corner, then blasts up through the roof and lip (crux) using some Sidewinding and winging.

20 feet right of Toit de Ben.  Big gaping offwidth.
Bigger than 6 inches so your #6's arent so good...  Bolted anchors at top on ledge to the right (non visible from ground).  mostly 8 inch about.  Caution when topping the roof not to knock your lower gear with the rope!  Interestingly enough my car jack was the best piece in the route!

Climb L'Éclair and continue straight up the dihedral (slightly to the left) where there are 3 obvious bolts. The crux is at the last bolt and it's not easy to find what works :)  Camalot #1 is useful after the crux. There is now a rap-anchor at the top so no more need to go out into the forest. Even if from the ground it looks like you need a 90m rope to go down, it's not the case. Make sure you are level with the tree and watch your rope ends if they touch. Grimper L'Éclair pour continuer tout droit dans le dièdre (légèrement à gauche) ou il y a 3 plaquettes évidentes. Le crux est à la dernière bolt et c'est pas facile de trouver de quoi qui fonctionne :)  Camalot #1 est utile après le crux. Il y a maintenant un relais équipé en haut donc plus besoin de sortir dans la foret. Même si du sol on dirait qu'il faut une corde de 90m pour redescendre , ce n'est pas le cas. Assurer au niveau de l'arbre et faire attention à la fin de votre corde et ça touche. Start at the left of Toit de Ben via l'Éclair.

Départ a gauche du Toit de Ben dans l'Éclair. Mixed

Towards the left end of the cliff, name is pretty descriptive.

Vers l'extrémité gauche de la falaise, le nom est assez descriptif.

Areas from Left to Right:
Amphitheatre
Zébrée
Impériale
Crown (Above Impériale)
Profil Grec (Above Sceptre)
Traversée
Vallot
Staircase
